bug.author: AzaelCicero
bug.summary: Cannot handle multi part git repositories
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h3>My actions before raising this issue</denchmark-h>
Read/searched the docs Searched past issues
Version 1.0.0 Regexes in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/cvat/blob/1b413c65a2a62d39876d074902eabd93cd7f9f41/cvat/apps/git/git.py#L75>https://github.com/opencv/cvat/blob/1b413c65a2a62d39876d074902eabd93cd7f9f41/cvat/apps/git/git.py#L75</denchmark-link> assumes that address has only one part address (i.e. <denchmark-link:mailto:git@github.com>git@github.com</denchmark-link> :something/reponame.git or <denchmark-link:https://github.com/something/reponame.git>https://github.com/something/reponame.git</denchmark-link> ) it will fail if provided address has multiple parts (i.e. <denchmark-link:mailto:git@github.com>git@github.com</denchmark-link> :something/group/subgroup/reponame.git or <denchmark-link:https://github.com/something/group/subgroup/reponame.git>https://github.com/something/group/subgroup/reponame.git</denchmark-link> ) <denchmark-h:h3>Expected Behaviour</denchmark-h>
It should accept multi part repository addresses <denchmark-h:h3>Current Behaviour</denchmark-h>
CVAT will trim address to first part and will try to pull from it: Input: <denchmark-link:mailto:git@github.com>git@github.com</denchmark-link> :something/group/subgroup/reponame.git Command called by CVAT git clone -v <denchmark-link:mailto:git@github.com>git@github.com</denchmark-link> :something/group.git /home/django/data/tasks/12/artifacts/repos <denchmark-h:h3>Possible Solution</denchmark-h>
Alter regexes to accept multipart repository address. <denchmark-h:h3>Steps to Reproduce (for bugs)</denchmark-h>
Create new task with GIT repository git@github.com:something/group/subgroup/reponame.git Try submit which will fail
<denchmark-h:h3>Context</denchmark-h>
I am using groups in gitlab to organize my repositories. <denchmark-h:h3>Your Environment</denchmark-h>
